#' @param printLowest whether to print the lowest treatment level with significant findings.

                    		
                  

                  

                    802
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Additional arguments (not used) generic for print method.

                    		
                  

                  

                    803
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    804
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Invisibly returns the object

                    		
                  

                  

                    805
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    806
                    
                    
                      
#' @method print StepDownRSCABS

                    		
                  

                  

                    807
                    
                    
                      
print.StepDownRSCABS <- function(x, printLowest=FALSE,...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    808
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("Step-Down RSCABS Analysis\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    809
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("========================\n\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    810
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    811
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("Parameters:\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    812
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("  Direction:", x$parameters$direction, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    813
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("  Alternative hypothesis:", x$parameters$alternative, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    814
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("  Treatment levels:", paste(x$parameters$treatment_order, collapse = ", "), "\n\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    815
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    816
                    3x
                    
                      
  cat("Summary of findings:\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    817
                    3x
                    
                      
  for (i in seq_along(x$summary)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    818
                    9x
                    
                      
    cat("Step", i, ": ")

                    		
                  

                  

                    819
                    9x
                    
                      
    cat("Included treatments:", x$summary[[i]]$included_treatments, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    820
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    821
                    9x
                    
                      
    if (x$summary[[i]]$has_significant_findings) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    822
                    6x
                    
                      
      cat("  Significant thresholds:",

                    		
                  

                  

                    823
                    6x
                    
                      
          paste(x$summary[[i]]$significant_thresholds, collapse = ", "), "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    824
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    825
                    3x
                    
                      
      cat("  No significant findings\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    826
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    827
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    828
                    3x
                    
                      
  if(printLowest){

                    		
                  

                  

                    829
                    2x
                    
                      
    cat("\nLowest treatment level with significant findings:\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    830
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (!is.na(x$lowest_significant$step)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    831
                    2x
                    
                      
      cat("  Treatment:", x$lowest_significant$treatment, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    832
                    2x
                    
                      
      cat("  Threshold:", x$lowest_significant$threshold, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    833
                    2x
                    
                      
      cat("  P-value:", round(x$lowest_significant$p_value, 4), "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    834
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    835
                    !
                    
                      
      cat("  No significant findings at any treatment level\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    836
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    837
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    838
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    839
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    840
                    3x
                    
                      
  invisible(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    841
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    842
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    843
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot method for StepDownRSCABS objects

                    		
                  

                  

                    844
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    845
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x A StepDownRSCABS object

                    		
                  

                  

                    846
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Additional arguments (not used)

                    		
                  

                  

                    847
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    848
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A ggplot object

                    		
                  

                  

                    849
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom ggplot2 ggplot aes geom_tile geom_text scale_fill_gradient scale_y_reverse labs theme_minimal theme element_text element_blank

                    		
                  

                  

                    850
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    851
                    
                    
                      
plot.StepDownRSCABS <- function(x, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    852
                    
                    
                      
  # Prepare data for plotting

                    		
                  

                  

                    853
                    1x
                    
                      
  plot_data <- x$combined_results

                    		
                  

                  

                    854
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    855
                    
                    
                      
  # Create step labels

                    		
                  

                  

                    856
                    1x
                    
                      
  step_labels <- sapply(seq_along(x$summary), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    857
                    3x
                    
                      
    paste("Step", i, ":", x$summary[[i]]$highest_treatment)

                    		
                  

                  

                    858
                    
                    
                      
  })

                    		
                  

                  

                    859
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    860
                    
                    
                      
  # Create the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    861
                    1x
                    
                      
  p <- ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = .data$Threshold, y = .data$Step, fill = -log10(.data$P_value))) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    862
                    1x
                    
                      
    geom_tile(color = "white") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    863
                    1x
                    
                      
    geom_text(aes(label = sprintf("%.4f", round(.data$P_value, 4))), color = "black", size = 3) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    864
                    1x
                    
                      
    scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = "steelblue",

                    		
                  

                  

                    865
                    1x
                    
                      
                        name = "-log10(p-value)") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    866
                    1x
                    
                      
    scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq_along(step_labels),

                    		
                  

                  

                    867
                    1x
                    
                      
                    labels = step_labels) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    868
                    1x
                    
                      
    labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    869
                    1x
                    
                      
      title = "Step-Down RSCABS Results",

                    		
                  

                  

                    870
                    1x
                    
                      
      subtitle = "P-values for each threshold at each step",

                    		
                  

                  

                    871
                    1x
                    
                      
      x = "Injury Threshold",

                    		
                  

                  

                    872
                    1x
                    
                      
      y = "Step"

                    		
                  

                  

                    873
                    
                    
                      
    ) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    874
                    1x
                    
                      
    theme_minimal() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    875
                    1x
                    
                      
    theme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    876
                    1x
                    
                      
      plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    877
                    1x
                    
                      
      axis.text = element_text(size = 10),

                    		
                  

                  

                    878
                    1x
                    
                      
      panel.grid.major = element_blank(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    879
                    1x
                    
                      
      panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    880
                    1x
                    
                      
      legend.position = "right"

                    		
                  

                  

                    881
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    882
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    883
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    884
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    885
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    886
                    
                    
                      
#' Summary method for StepDownRSCABS objects

                    		
                  

                  

                    887
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    888
                    
                    
                      
#' @param object A StepDownRSCABS object

                    		
                  

                  

                    889
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Additional arguments (not used)

                    		
                  

                  

                    890
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    891
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with summary information

                    		
                  

                  

                    892
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    893
                    
                    
                      
summary.StepDownRSCABS <- function(object, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    894
                    
                    
                      
  # Create a summary data frame of results

                    		
                  

                  

                    895
                    1x
                    
                      
  summary_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    896
                    1x
                    
                      
    Step = integer(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    897
                    1x
                    
                      
    Included_Treatments = character(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    898
                    1x
                    
                      
    Highest_Treatment = character(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    899
                    1x
                    
                      
    Significant_Thresholds = character(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    900
                    1x
                    
                      
    Min_P_Value = numeric(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    901
                    1x
                    
                      
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    902
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    903
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    904
                    1x
                    
                      
  for (i in seq_along(object$summary)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    905
                    3x
                    
                      
    step_summary <- object$summary[[i]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    906
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    907
                    3x
                    
                      
    if (step_summary$has_significant_findings) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    908
                    2x
                    
                      
      sig_thresholds <- paste(step_summary$significant_thresholds, collapse = ", ")

                    		
                  

                  

                    909
                    2x
                    
                      
      min_p <- min(object$combined_results$P_value[

                    		
                  

                  

                    910
                    2x
                    
                      
        object$combined_results$Step == i &

                    		
                  

                  

                    911
                    2x
                    
                      
          object$combined_results$Threshold %in% step_summary$significant_thresholds

                    		
                  

                  

                    912
                    
                    
                      
      ])

                    		
                  

                  

                    913
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    914
                    1x
                    
                      
      sig_thresholds <- "None"

                    		
                  

                  

                    915
                    1x
                    
                      
      min_p <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    916
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    917
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    918
                    3x
                    
                      
    summary_df <- rbind(summary_df, data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    919
                    3x
                    
                      
      Step = i,

                    		
                  

                  

                    920
                    3x
                    
                      
      Included_Treatments = step_summary$included_treatments,

                    		
                  

                  

                    921
                    3x
                    
                      
      Highest_Treatment = step_summary$highest_treatment,

                    		
                  

                  

                    922
                    3x
                    
                      
      Significant_Thresholds = sig_thresholds,

                    		
                  

                  

                    923
                    3x
                    
                      
      Min_P_Value = min_p,

                    		
                  

                  

                    924
                    3x
                    
                      
      stringsAsFactors = FALSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    925
                    
                    
                      
    ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    926
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    927
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    928
                    
                    
                      
  # Return summary information

                    		
                  

                  

                    929
                    1x
                    
                      
  list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    930
                    1x
                    
                      
    summary_table = summary_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    931
                    1x
                    
                      
    lowest_significant = object$lowest_significant,

                    		
                  

                  

                    932
                    1x
                    
                      
    parameters = object$parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    933
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    934
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
## Functions for preliminary assessment of dose response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Preliminary Plot 1 for Dose Response Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' This function generates a scatter plot of response against nominal dose.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param testdata A data frame containing the dose and response data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ylab A string for the y-axis label. Default is "Response".

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xlab A string for the x-axis label. Default is `"Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param title A string for the plot title. Default is "Measured Variable".

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_col name of the dose column, default being "Dose".

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_col name of the response column.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A ggplot object.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
prelimPlot1 <- function(testdata, dose_col = "Dose", response_col = "Response",

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
                        ylab = "Response", xlab = "Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
                        title = "Measured Variable") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
  # Convert the dose column to a factor if it's numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (is.numeric(testdata[[dose_col]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    1x
                    
                      
    testdata[[dose_col]] <- factor(testdata[[dose_col]],

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    1x
                    
                      
                                   levels = sort(unique(testdata[[dose_col]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
  # Create the plot using ggplot2 with .data pronoun

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    1x
                    
                      
  p <- ggplot(testdata, aes(x = .data[[dose_col]], y = .data[[response_col]])) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    1x
                    
                      
    geom_point() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    1x
                    
                      
    ylab(ylab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    1x
                    
                      
    xlab(xlab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    1x
                    
                      
    ggtitle(title)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
## Another version of prelimPlot1.0, keeping it here for references of not using strings.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
# prelimPlot1.0 <- function(testdata, dose_col = Dose, response_col = Response,

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#                         ylab = "Response", xlab = "Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#                         title = "Measured Variable") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#   # Convert the dose column to a factor if it's numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#   if (is.numeric(testdata[[deparse(substitute(dose_col))]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#     testdata[[deparse(substitute(dose_col))]] <- factor(testdata[[deparse(substitute(dose_col))]],

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#                                                         levels = sort(unique(testdata[[deparse(substitute(dose_col))]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#   }

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#   # Create the plot using ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#   p <- ggplot(testdata, aes(x = {{ dose_col }}, y = {{ response_col }})) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#     geom_point() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#     ylab(ylab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#     xlab(xlab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#     ggtitle(title)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#   return(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
# }

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' Preliminary Plot 2 for Dose Response Data, with x continuous.

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' This function generates a scatter plot of response against dose on a log1p scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' @param testdata A data frame containing the dose and response data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ylab A string for the y-axis label. Default is "Response".

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xlab A string for the x-axis label. Default is `"Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' @param title A string for the plot title. Default is "Measured Variable".

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_col name of the dose column, default being "Dose".

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_col name of the response column.

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A ggplot object.

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' @import scales

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
prelimPlot2 <- function(testdata, ylab = "Response", xlab = "Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
                        title = "Measured Variable", dose_col = "Dose",response_col="Response") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1x
                    
                      
  ilog1p <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    !
                    
                      
    exp(x) - 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    1x
                    
                      
  testdata[[dose_col]] <- as.numeric(as.character(testdata[[dose_col]]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
  # Get unique doses and sort them

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    1x
                    
                      
  doses <- sort(unique(testdata[[dose_col]]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
  # Create the plot using ggplot2 with .data pronoun

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    1x
                    
                      
  p <- ggplot(testdata, aes(x = .data[[dose_col]], y = .data[[response_col]])) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    1x
                    
                      
    geom_point() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    1x
                    
                      
    ylab(ylab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    1x
                    
                      
    xlab(xlab) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    1x
                    
                      
    ggtitle(title) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = doses, trans = scales::trans_new("log1p", log1p, ilog1p)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    1x
                    
                      
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#' Preliminary Plot 3 for Dose Response Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#' This function generates a scatter plot of response against nominal dose.

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#' @param testdata A data frame containing the dose and response data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ylab A string for the y-axis label. Default is "Response".

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xlab A string for the x-axis label. Default is `"Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#' @param title A string for the plot title. Default is "Measured Variable".

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a the quantile for corresponding CI for mean. default is qnorm(0.975).

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_col name of the dose column, default being "Dose".

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_col name of the response column.

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A ggplot object.

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
#' @import dplyr

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords PrelimnaryAssessments

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
prelimPlot3 <- function(testdata, ylab = "Response", xlab = "Test Concentration [nominal, mg a.s./L]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
                        title = "Measured Variable", a = 1.96, dose_col = "Dose", response_col = "Response") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
  # Convert the dose column to a factor if it's numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.numeric(testdata[[dose_col]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    !
                    
                      
    testdata[[dose_col]] <- factor(testdata[[dose_col]],

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    !
                    
                      
                                   levels = sort(unique(testdata[[dose_col]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
  # Create the initial plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    !
                    
                      
  p <- prelimPlot1(testdata = testdata, dose_col = dose_col, response_col=response_col,

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    !
                    
                      
                   ylab = ylab, xlab = xlab, title = title)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
  # Summarize the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    !
                    
                      
  datsum <- testdata %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    !
                    
                      
    group_by(.data[[dose_col]]) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    !
                    
                      
    summarise(mean = mean(.data[[response_col]]),

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    !
                    
                      
              SE = sd(.data[[response_col]]) / sqrt(length(.data[[response_col]]))) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
    mutate(Lower = .data$mean - a * .data$SE, Upper = .data$mean + a * .data$SE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
  # Add points and error bars to the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    !
                    
                      
  p <- p +

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    !
                    
                      
    geom_point(data = datsum,

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    !
                    
                      
               aes(x = as.numeric(as.factor(.data[[dose_col]])) + 0.15,

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    !
                    
                      
                   y = mean),

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
               position = position_dodge(width = 0.9),

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    !
                    
                      
               col = "red", size = 3, shape = 24, fill = "pink") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    !
                    
                      
    geom_errorbar(data = datsum,

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    !
                    
                      
                  aes(x = as.numeric(as.factor(.data[[dose_col]])) + 0.15,

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    !
                    
                      
                      y = mean, ymin = .data$Lower, ymax = .data$Upper),

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    !
                    
                      
                  col = "red", position = position_dodge(width = 0.9), width = .1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    !
                    
                      
  return(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
#' Preliminary Summary of Dose Response Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
#' This function calculates the mean response, standard deviation, percent inhibition, and coefficient of variation for each dose level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
#' @param testdata A data frame containing the dose and response data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_col name of the dose column, default being "Dose".

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_col name of the response column.

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A data frame summarizing the mean, standard deviation, percent inhibition, and coefficient of variation for each dose.

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
#' @import dplyr

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords PrelimnaryAssessments

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
#' # Sample data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
#' testdata <- data.frame(Dose = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 0, 1, 2, 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
#'                       Response = c(10, 20, 30, 40, 12, 22, 32, 42))

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
#' # Create the summary

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      
#' summary_result <- prelimSummary(testdata, dose_col = "Dose", response_col = "Response")

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
#' print(summary_result)

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
prelimSummary <- function(testdata, dose_col = "Dose", response_col = "Response") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
  # Filter control group (Dose == 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    1x
                    
                      
  ctr <- testdata %>% filter(.data[[dose_col]] == 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    1x
                    
                      
  ctr0 <- mean(ctr[[response_col]], na.rm = TRUE)  # Calculate mean response for control group

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
  # Summarize the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    1x
                    
                      
  sres <- testdata %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    1x
                    
                      
    group_by(.data[[dose_col]]) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    1x
                    
                      
    summarise(Mean = mean(.data[[response_col]], na.rm = TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    1x
                    
                      
              SD = sd(.data[[response_col]], na.rm = TRUE)) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    1x
                    
                      
    mutate(`% Inhibition` = -((.data$Mean - ctr0) / ctr0) * 100,

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    1x
                    
                      
           CV = .data$SD / .data$Mean * 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(sres)

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Conduct Dunnett Test with Various Model Specifications

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This function performs Dunnett's test for comparing multiple treatment levels to a control

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' using various model specifications, including options for random effects and variance structures.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data A data frame containing the dose-response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' Conduct Dunnett Test with Various Model Specifications

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' This function performs Dunnett's test for comparing multiple treatment levels to a control

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' using various model specifications, including options for random effects and variance structures.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data A data frame containing the dose-response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_var Name of the response variable column

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_var Name of the dose/treatment variable column

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param block_var Name of the blocking/tank variable column (optional)

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param control_level The level of dose_var to use as control (default is minimum dose)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param include_random_effect Logical, whether to include random effects for blocks/tanks

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param variance_structure Character, specifying the variance structure:

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   "homoscedastic" (default) or "heteroscedastic"

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Significance level for determining NOEC (default = 0.05)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @param conf_level Confidence level for intervals (default = 0.95)

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param return_model Logical, whether to return the fitted model object (default = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alternative a character string specifying the alternative hypothesis, must be

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' one of '"two.sided"' (default), '"greater"' or '"less"'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the Dunnett test results, NOEC value, and optionally the model object

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom multcomp glht mcp

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom lme4 lmer

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom nlme gls lme varIdent

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats as.formula

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @concept NOEC

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
dunnett_test <- function(data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
                         response_var = "Response",

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
                         dose_var = "Dose",

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
                         block_var = "Tank",

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
                         control_level = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
                         include_random_effect = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
                         variance_structure = c("homoscedastic", "heteroscedastic"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
                         alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
                         conf_level = 0.95,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
                         return_model = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
                         alternative = c("two.sided", "greater", "less")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
  # Input validation

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!is.data.frame(data)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    !
                    
                      
    stop("Data must be a data frame")

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!response_var %in% names(data)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    !
                    
                      
    stop(paste("Response variable", response_var, "not found in data"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!dose_var %in% names(data)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    !
                    
                      
    stop(paste("Dose/treatment variable", dose_var, "not found in data"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  # Ensure dose variable is a factor

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!is.factor(data[[dose_var]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    !
                    
                      
    data[[dose_var]] <- factor(data[[dose_var]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  # Set control level if not specified

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.null(control_level)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
    # Use the minimum dose level as control

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    !
                    
                      
    control_level <- levels(data[[dose_var]])[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
    # Ensure control_level is in the levels

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!as.character(control_level) %in% levels(data[[dose_var]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    !
                    
                      
      stop("Control level not found in dose variable levels")

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
  # Match variance structure argument

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    !
                    
                      
  variance_structure <- match.arg(variance_structure)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
  alternative <- match.arg(alternative)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  # Check if block variable exists when random effects are requested

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    !
                    
                      
  if (include_random_effect && !block_var %in% names(data)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
    stop(paste("Block/tank variable", block_var, "not found in data"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
  # Create formula strings

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
  fixed_formula_str <- paste(response_var, "~", dose_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
  fixed_formula <- as.formula(fixed_formula_str)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
  # Fit the appropriate model based on specifications

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
  if (include_random_effect) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
    if (variance_structure == "homoscedastic") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
      # Mixed model with homoscedastic errors

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
      message("Fitting mixed model with homoscedastic errors")

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    !
                    
                      
      model <- lme4::lmer(

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    !
                    
                      
        as.formula(paste(fixed_formula_str, "+ (1|", block_var, ")")),

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
        data = data

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
      # Mixed model with heteroscedastic errors by dose level

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    !
                    
                      
      message("Fitting mixed model with heteroscedastic errors")

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    !
                    
                      
      model <- nlme::lme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    !
                    
                      
        fixed = fixed_formula,

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    !
                    
                      
        random = as.formula(paste("~ 1 |", block_var)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    !
                    
                      
        weights = nlme::varIdent(form = as.formula(paste("~ 1 |", dose_var))),

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    !
                    
                      
        data = data

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
    }
