                    !
                    
                      
    ED.plus(obj,

                    		
                  

                  

                    639
                    !
                    
                      
            respLev,

                    		
                  

                  

                    640
                    !
                    
                      
            trend = trend, ...) })

                    		
                  

                  

                    641
                    
                    
                      
  ## map2(modList,edList,function(x,y){

                    		
                  

                  

                    642
                    
                    
                      
  ## predict(x,newdata=data.frame(Concentration=y[,1]))})

                    		
                  

                  

                    643
                    
                    
                      
  ## Check if Prediction Make sense

                    		
                  

                  

                    644
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    645
                    !
                    
                      
  NW <- lapply(edList, calcNW)

                    		
                  

                  

                    646
                    !
                    
                      
  edRes <- purrr::map2(edList, NW, cbind)

                    		
                  

                  

                    647
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    648
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    649
                    !
                    
                      
  edResTab <- plyr::ldply(lapply(edRes, function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    650
                    !
                    
                      
    x <- as.data.frame(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    651
                    !
                    
                      
    if (ncol(x) == 3) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    652
                    !
                    
                      
      x$`Std. Error` <- rep(NA, nrow(x))

                    		
                  

                  

                    653
                    !
                    
                      
      x <- x[, c(1, 4, 2, 3)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    654
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    655
                    !
                    
                      
    x$EC <- rownames(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    656
                    !
                    
                      
    rownames(x) <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    657
                    !
                    
                      
    x

                    		
                  

                  

                    658
                    
                    
                      
  }))

                    		
                  

                  

                    659
                    !
                    
                      
  return(edResTab)

                    		
                  

                  

                    660
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    661
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    662
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    663
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate Normalized Width for Effect Concentration Estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    664
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    665
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    666
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculates the normalized width of confidence intervals for effect concentration

                    		
                  

                  

                    667
                    
                    
                      
#' (EC) estimates by dividing the interval width by the estimate value. Also

                    		
                  

                  

                    668
                    
                    
                      
#' provides a rating for the calculated normalized width.

                    		
                  

                  

                    669
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    670
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x A data frame containing EC estimates, typically output from ED

                    		
                  

                  

                    671
                    
                    
                      
#'   function. Must contain columns 'Upper', 'Lower', and 'Estimate'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    672
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ED Character string indicating the source of EC estimates. Must be either

                    		
                  

                  

                    673
                    
                    
                      
#'   "ZG" (default) or "drc".

                    		
                  

                  

                    674
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    675
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A data frame with two columns:

                    		
                  

                  

                    676
                    
                    
                      
#'   \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    677
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item NW: Normalized width calculated as (Upper - Lower) / Estimate

                    		
                  

                  

                    678
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item Rating: Categorical rating of the normalized width

                    		
                  

                  

                    679
                    
                    
                      
#'   }

                    		
                  

                  

                    680
                    
                    
                      
#'   Row names are preserved from input for "ZG" or modified to "EC_x" format

                    		
                  

                  

                    681
                    
                    
                      
#'   for "drc".

                    		
                  

                  

                    682
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    683
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    684
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    685
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    686
                    
                    
                      
#' # Example with ZG format

                    		
                  

                  

                    687
                    
                    
                      
#' ec_data <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    688
                    
                    
                      
#'   Lower = c(1.2, 2.3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    689
                    
                    
                      
#'   Upper = c(1.8, 3.1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    690
                    
                    
                      
#'   Estimate = c(1.5, 2.7),

                    		
                  

                  

                    691
                    
                    
                      
#'   row.names = c("EC10", "EC50")

                    		
                  

                  

                    692
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    693
                    
                    
                      
#' calcNW(ec_data, ED = "ZG")

                    		
                  

                  

                    694
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    695
                    
                    
                      
#' # Example with drc format

                    		
                  

                  

                    696
                    
                    
                      
#' drc_data <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    697
                    
                    
                      
#'   Lower = c(1.2, 2.3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    698
                    
                    
                      
#'   Upper = c(1.8, 3.1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    699
                    
                    
                      
#'   Estimate = c(1.5, 2.7),

                    		
                  

                  

                    700
                    
                    
                      
#'   row.names = c("Dose:1:10", "Dose:1:50")

                    		
                  

                  

                    701
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    702
                    
                    
                      
#' calcNW(drc_data, ED = "drc")

                    		
                  

                  

                    703
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    704
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \code{\link{ECx_rating}} for the rating system used

                    		
                  

                  

                    705
                    
                    
                      
calcNW <- function(x, ED = "ZG") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    706
                    !
                    
                      
  x <- as.data.frame(x) ## x is the ED object from ED function.

                    		
                  

                  

                    707
                    !
                    
                      
  out <- as.data.frame((x$Upper - x$Lower) / x$Estimate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    708
                    !
                    
                      
  if (ED == "ZG") newRowNames <- rownames(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    709
                    !
                    
                      
  if (ED == "drc") newRowNames <- paste0("EC_", do.call(c, lapply(strsplit(row.names(x), ":"), function(y) y[3]))) # nolint: line_length_linter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    710
                    !
                    
                      
  out <- cbind(out, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    711
                    !
                    
                      
  out[, 2] <- ECx_rating(out[, 1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    712
                    !
                    
                      
  row.names(out) <- newRowNames

                    		
                  

                  

                    713
                    !
                    
                      
  names(out) <- c("NW", "Rating")

                    		
                  

                  

                    714
                    !
                    
                      
  return(out)

                    		
                  

                  

                    715
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    716
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    717
                    
                    
                      
#' Rate Effect Concentration Estimates Based on Normalized Width

                    		
                  

                  

                    718
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    719
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    720
                    
                    
                      
#' Assigns qualitative ratings to normalized width values of confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    721
                    
                    
                      
#' based on predefined thresholds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    722
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    723
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x Numeric vector of normalized width values to be rated

                    		
                  

                  

                    724
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    725
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Character vector of ratings with the following categories:

                    		
                  

                  

                    726
                    
                    
                      
#'   \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    727
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Excellent" for NW < 0.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    728
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Good" for 0.2 <= NW < 0.5

                    		
                  

                  

                    729
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Fair" for 0.5 <= NW < 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    730
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Poor" for 1 <= NW < 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    731
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Bad" for NW >= 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    732
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item "Not defined" for NA or NaN values

                    		
                  

                  

                    733
                    
                    
                      
#'   }

                    		
                  

                  

                    734
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    735
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    736
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    737
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    738
                    
                    
                      
#' # Basic examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    739
                    
                    
                      
#' ECx_rating(c(0.1, 0.3, 0.7, 1.5, 2.5, NA))

                    		
                  

                  

                    740
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    741
                    
                    
                      
#' # Example with typical normalized widths

                    		
                  

                  

                    742
                    
                    
                      
#' nw_values <- c(0.15, 0.45, 0.95, 1.8, 2.5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    743
                    
                    
                      
#' ECx_rating(nw_values)

                    		
                  

                  

                    744
                    
                    
                      
ECx_rating <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    745
                    
                    
                      
  ## normalised width (NW) of CI

                    		
                  

                  

                    746
                    
                    
                      
  ## NW   |  Rating # nolint: commented_code_linter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    747
                    
                    
                      
  ## ----------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    748
                    
                    
                      
  ## <0.2 | Excellent

                    		
                  

                  

                    749
                    
                    
                      
  ## <0.5 | Good

                    		
                  

                  

                    750
                    
                    
                      
  ## <1   | Fair

                    		
                  

                  

                    751
                    
                    
                      
  ## <2   | Poor

                    		
                  

                  

                    752
                    
                    
                      
  ## >2   | Bad

                    		
                  

                  

                    753
                    5x
                    
                      
  outRating <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    754
                    5x
                    
                      
  for (i in x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    755
                    10x
                    
                      
    if (is.nan(i) || is.na(i)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    756
                    3x
                    
                      
      outRating <- c(outRating, "Not defined")

                    		
                  

                  

                    757
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    758
                    7x
                    
                      
      if (i < 0.2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    759
                    1x
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Excellent")

                    		
                  

                  

                    760
                    6x
                    
                      
      } else if (i < 0.5) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    761
                    2x
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Good")

                    		
                  

                  

                    762
                    4x
                    
                      
      } else if (i < 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    763
                    1x
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Fair")

                    		
                  

                  

                    764
                    3x
                    
                      
      } else if (i < 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    765
                    1x
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Poor")

                    		
                  

                  

                    766
                    2x
                    
                      
      } else if (i >= 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    767
                    2x
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Bad")

                    		
                  

                  

                    768
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    769
                    !
                    
                      
        outRating <- c(outRating, "Not defined")

                    		
                  

                  

                    770
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    771
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    772
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    773
                    5x
                    
                      
  return(outRating)

                    		
                  

                  

                    774
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    775
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    776
                    
                    
                      
#' Compare Dose-Response Models Using Multiple Criteria

                    		
                  

                  

                    777
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    778
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    779
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs comprehensive comparison of dose-response models using multiple

                    		
                  

                  

                    780
                    
                    
                      
#' criteria including model fit, certainty of protection, and steepness.

                    		
                  

                  

                    781
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    782
                    
                    
                      
#' @param modRes Optional. Result object containing model comparison information.

                    		
                  

                  

                    783
                    
                    
                      
#'   If provided, modList parameter is ignored.

                    		
                  

                  

                    784
                    
                    
                      
#' @param modList Optional. List of fitted dose-response models to compare.

                    		
                  

                  

                    785
                    
                    
                      
#'   Required if modRes is NULL.

                    		
                  

                  

                    786
                    
                    
                      
#' @param trend Character string specifying the expected trend direction.

                    		
                  

                  

                    787
                    
                    
                      
#'   Must be "Decrease" or "Increase".

                    		
                  

                  

                    788
                    
                    
                      
#' @param CI Character string specifying the confidence interval method.

                    		
                  

                  

                    789
                    
                    
                      
#'   One of "delta", "inv", or "bmd-inv". Defaults to "delta".

                    		
                  

                  

                    790
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Additional arguments passed to internal functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    791
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    792
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A data frame containing model comparison results with columns:

                    		
                  

                  

                    793
                    
                    
                      
#'   \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    794
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item Original comparison metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    795
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item Certainty_Protection: Measure of protection certainty

                    		
                  

                  

                    796
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item Steepness: Model steepness evaluation

                    		
                  

                  

                    797
                    
                    
                      
#'     \item No Effect p-val: P-value for test against no-effect model

                    		
                  

                  

                    798
                    
                    
                      
#'   }

                    		
                  

                  

                    799
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    800
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    801
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    802
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    803
                    
                    
                      
#' \dontrun{

                    		
                  

                  

                    804
                    
                    
                      
#' data("dat_medium")

                    		
                  

                  

                    805
                    
                    
                      
#' dat_medium <- dat_medium %>% mutate(Treatment=factor(Dose,levels=unique(Dose)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    806
                    
                    
                      
#' dat_medium$Response[dat_medium$Response < 0] <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    807
                    
                    
                      
#' mod <- drm(Response~Dose,data=dat_medium,fct=LL.3())

                    		
                  

                  

                    808
                    
                    
                      
#' fctList <- list(LN.4(),LL.4(),W1.3(),LL2.2())

                    		
                  

                  

                    809
                    
                    
                      
#' res <- mselect.plus(mod,fctList = fctList )

                    		
                  

                  

                    810
                    
                    
                      
#' modList <- res$modList

                    		
                  

                  

                    811
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    812
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compare models using existing comparison results

                    		
                  

                  

                    813
                    
                    
                      
#' drcCompare(modRes = res, trend = "Decrease")

                    		
                  

                  

                    814
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    815
                    
                    
                      
drcCompare <- function(modRes = NULL, modList = NULL, trend = "Decrease",

                    		
                  

                  

                    816
                    
                    
                      
                       CI = c("delta", "inv", "bmd-inv"), ...) { # nolint

                    		
                  

                  

                    817
                    4x
                    
                      
  CI <- match.arg(CI)

                    		
                  

                  

                    818
                    3x
                    
                      
  if (!is.null(modRes)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    819
                    
                    
                      
    ## take the comarison matrix from modRes

                    		
                  

                  

                    820
                    2x
                    
                      
    modList <- modRes$modList

                    		
                  

                  

                    821
                    2x
                    
                      
    comparison <- modRes$Comparison

                    		
                  

                  

                    822
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    823
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (is.null(modList)) stop("Need the model output list from previous step!") else{

                    		
                  

                  

                    824
                    
                    
                      
      ## use modList directly

                    		
                  

                  

                    825
                    !
                    
                      
      stop("A direct model comparison has not yet implemented, this is a placeholder.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    826
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    827
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    828
                    
                    
                      
  # A significance test is provided for the comparison of the dose-response model considered and the simple linear regression model with slope 0 (a horizontal regression line corresponding to no dose effect) # nolint: line_length_linter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    829
                    
                    
                      
  # The likelihood ratio test statistic and the corresponding degrees of freedom and p-value are reported. # nolint: line_length_linter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    830
                    2x
                    
                      
  a <- plyr::ldply(modList, function(obj) if (inherits(obj, "try-error")) c(`Chi-square test` = NA, Df = NA, `p-value` = NA) else drc::noEffect(obj)) # nolint: line_length_linter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    831
                    2x
                    
                      
  Overlap <- plyr::ldply(modList, calcSteepnessOverlap, CI = CI)

                    		
                  

                  

                    832
                    2x
                    
                      
  names(Overlap) <- c(".id", "Certainty_Protection", "Steepness")

                    		
                  

                  

                    833
                    2x
                    
                      
  CompRes <- cbind(comparison, Overlap[, -1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    834
                    2x
                    
                      
  CompRes <- cbind(CompRes, a[, "p-value"])

                    		
                  

                  

                    835
                    2x
                    
                      
  colnames(CompRes)[ncol(CompRes)] <- "No Effect p-val"

                    		
                  

                  

                    836
                    2x
                    
                      
  return(CompRes)

                    		
                  

                  

                    837
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    838
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    839
                    
                    
                      
#' Helper function for scaling x-axis

                    		
                  

                  

                    840
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    841
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x a vector of numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    842
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a a vector of nummeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    843
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    844
                    
                    
                      
#' @return log(x+a)

                    		
                  

                  

                    845
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    846
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    847
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples logxp(0, 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    848
                    
                    
                      
logxp <- function(x, a) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    849
                    1x
                    
                      
  log(a + x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    850
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    851
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    852
                    
                    
                      
#' inverse transformation of logxp

                    		
                  

                  

                    853
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    854
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x a numeric vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    855
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a a numeric vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    856
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    857
                    
                    
                      
#' @return inverse log of x and a

                    		
                  

                  

                    858
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    859
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    860
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples invlogxp(3, 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    861
                    
                    
                      
invlogxp <- function(x, a) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    862
                    1x
                    
                      
  exp(x) - a

                    		
                  

                  

                    863
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    864
                    
                    
                      
## Example definition of a new transformation in ggplot

                    		
                  

                  

                    865
                    
                    
                      
## logxp_trans <- function(a=0.001) scales::trans_new("logxp",

                    		
                  

                  

                    866
                    
                    
                      
## transform=function(x)logxp(x,a=a),

                    		
                  

                  

                    867
                    
                    
                      
## inverse=function(x)invlogxp(x,a=a))

                    		
                  

                  

                    868
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    869
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
## Note this script is adapted from the archived version of StatCharrms developed by Joe Swintek [aut, cre],

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
## Kevin Flynn[ctb] and Jon Haselman [ctb]. StatCharrms_0.90.1.tar.gz	2017-05-08 15:23	964K(https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/StatCharrms/StatCharrms_0.90.1.tar.gz)

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
## Original package licence is License: CC0, which means no copyrights reserved. However,

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
## the authors and the archive link are kept in this file so the source can be traced back.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
## Unit Testing: test_TrendTeset.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Testing Monotonicity

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' The function is adapted from the archived version of StatCharrms developed by

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Joe Swintek et al with CC0 license. It is not updated anymore and included

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' for validation purpose. There are other ways to perform a trend test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' This function tests whether a dose-response relationship follows a monotonic

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' trend (consistently increasing or decreasing) by analyzing both linear and

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' quadratic components of the relationship.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data Data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment name of the treatment variable

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Response name of the response variable

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @return monotonicity table

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats contrasts<-

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' The test first applies a rank transformation to the response variable using

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' the rankTransform function, which implements Blom's method (equivalent to

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' SAS PROC RANK with NORMAL=BLOM). Next it creates linear and quadratic

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' contrasts using the getLineContrast and getQuadContrast functions. Then it

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' fits an ANOVA model using the transformed response variable and extracts

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' the summary statistics from the ANOVA model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' Interpretations:

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' If only the linear component is significant: Strong evidence for monotonicity.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' If both linear and quadratic components are significant: The relationship is

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' monotonic but with curvature. If only the quadratic component is significant:

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' The relationship is likely non-monotonic (e.g., U-shaped). If neither

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' component is significant: No clear dose-response relationship detected

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' Note that contrasts<- need to be imported from stats.This is a function

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' that is used to set contrasts on factors.

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' \dontrun{

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' x <- c(106, 114, 116, 127, 145,110, 125, 143, 148, 151,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' 136, 139, 149, 160, 174)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' g <- gl(3,5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' levels(g) <- c("0", "I", "II")

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' monotonicityTest(data.frame(treatment_var = g,response_var=x),

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' "treatment_var", "response_var")

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' mock_data <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' treatment_var = factor(rep(c("Control", "Dose1", "Dose2", "Dose3"), each = 10)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' response_var = c(rnorm(10, mean = 5), rnorm(10, mean = 7),

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' rnorm(10, mean = 8), rnorm(10, mean = 10))

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' monotonicityTest(mock_data, "treatment_var", "response_var")

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
monotonicityTest <-function(Data,Treatment,Response){

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
  #This is the test for monotonicity as done in the SAS Version

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  #it sets up linear and Quadratic contrast for an ANOVA

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  #Uses .stdEndEnv$WeightVar

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
  Data <- as.data.frame(Data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  #Transform data for rank response

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
  Data<-rankTransform(Data,Response)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  #Form Contrasts

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    1x
                    
                      
  LineContrast<-getLineContrast(Data,Treatment)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    1x
                    
                      
  QuadContrast<-getQuadContrast(Data,Treatment)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    1x
                    
                      
  Contrasts <- cbind(LineContrast,QuadContrast)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1x
                    
                      
  colnames(Contrasts)<-c('Line','QuadContrast')

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
  #ANOVA

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    1x
                    
                      
  Data[ ,Treatment]<-as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment])

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    1x
                    
                      
  contrasts(Data[ ,Treatment])<-Contrasts

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    1x
                    
                      
  AnovaTable<-aov(Data[ ,'TransformedResponse']~as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  # if (is.null(.stdEndEnv$WeightVar)==FALSE){  #if there is a weight and the data is not averaged

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
  #   if (length(.stdEndEnv$WeightVar)==length(Data[ ,Response])){

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  #     AnovaTable<-aov(Data[ ,'TransformedResponse']~as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment]), weight=.stdEndEnv$WeightVar )

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
  #   }

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  # }

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
  #

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
  #gather information and clean the table

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
  CAnova<-summary.lm(AnovaTable)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable<-as.data.frame(CAnova$coefficients[2:3,3:4])

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    1x
                    
                      
  rownames(MonocityTable)<-NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable<-cbind(c('Linear','Quadratic'),MonocityTable,'.')

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    1x
                    
                      
  colnames(MonocityTable)[1]<-'Test'

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    1x
                    
                      
  colnames(MonocityTable)[4]<-'Significance'

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable$Significance<-as.character(MonocityTable$Significance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable$Significance[MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<0.05]<-'*'

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable$Significance[MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<0.01]<-'**'

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable$Significance[MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<0.001]<-'***'

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<-round(MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)'],4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (length(which(MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<10^-4))>0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    1x
                    
                      
    MonocityTable[which(MonocityTable[ ,'Pr(>|t|)']<10^-4),'Pr(>|t|)']<-'<0.0001'

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    1x
                    
                      
  MonocityTable[ ,'t value']<-round(MonocityTable[ ,'t value'],2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(MonocityTable)

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate Linear Contrast for Treatment Levels

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
#' This function calculates the contrast coefficients used to test for a linear relationship

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
#' across treatment levels.

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data A data frame containing the treatment variable

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment The name of the treatment variable in the data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of contrast coefficients for linear trend testing

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
#' test_data <- data.frame(Dose = factor(c(0, 1, 2, 3, 0, 1, 2, 3)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
#' getLineContrast(test_data, "Dose")

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
getLineContrast <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
  function(Data,Treatment){

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
    #This attains the contrast used to test a linear relationship

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    2x
                    
                      
    K<-nlevels(as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
    #Contrasts

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    2x
                    
                      
    switch (K,

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    !
                    
                      
            return(0),

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-1,1)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-1,0,1)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    2x
                    
                      
            return(c(-3,-1,1,3)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-2,-1,0,1, 2)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-5, -3, -1,1,3,5)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-3,-2, -1,0,1,2,3)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-7,-5,-3,-1,1,3,5,7)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-4,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,4)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(-9,-7,-5,-3,-1, 1,3, 5, 7,9)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    !
                    
                      
    return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate Quadratic Contrast for Treatment Levels

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
#' This function calculates the contrast coefficients used to test for a quadratic relationship

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
#' across treatment levels.

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data A data frame containing the treatment variable

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment The name of the treatment variable in the data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of contrast coefficients for quadratic trend testing

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
#' test_data <- data.frame(Dose = factor(c(0, 1, 2, 3, 0, 1, 2, 3)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
#' getQuadContrast(test_data, "Dose")

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
getQuadContrast <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
  function(Data,Treatment){

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
    #This attains the contrast used to test a quadratic relationship

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    2x
                    
                      
    K<-nlevels(as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
    #Contrasts

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    2x
                    
                      
    switch (K,

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    !
                    
                      
            return(0),

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c( 0,0)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c( 1,-2,1)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    2x
                    
                      
            return(c(1,-1,-1,1)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(2,-1,-2,-1,2)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(5,-1,-4,-4,-1,5)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(5,0,-3,-4,-3,0,5)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(7,1,-3,-5,-5,-3,1,7)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(28,7,-8,-17,-20,-17,-8,7,28)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    !
                    
                      
            return(c(6,2,-1,-3,-4,-4,-3,-1,2,6)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    !
                    
                      
    return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
#' Rank Transform Data Using Blom's Method

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    
                    
                      
#' This function performs a rank transformation on the data using Blom's method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      
#' which is equivalent to the SAS PROC RANK with NORMAL=BLOM and TIES=MEAN options.

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
#' The transformation applies the formula (r-3/8)/(n+1/4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      
#' where r is the rank and n is the sample size.

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data A data frame containing the variable to be transformed

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
#' @param VecName The name of the variable in the data frame to be transformed

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A data frame with an additional column 'TransformedResponse' containing the rank-transformed values

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
