  statistic   <- (S - sum(N))/sqrt(2*sum(N*(N-1)));

                    		
                  

                  

                    321
                    1x
                    
                      
  attr(statistic, "names") <- "z";

                    		
                  

                  

                    322
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    323
                    
                    
                      
  #Calculate p-value

                    		
                  

                  

                    324
                    1x
                    
                      
  p.value     <- 2*pnorm(-abs(statistic), 0, 1);

                    		
                  

                  

                    325
                    1x
                    
                      
  attr(p.value, "names") <- NULL;

                    		
                  

                  

                    326
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    327
                    
                    
                      
  #Create htest object

                    		
                  

                  

                    328
                    1x
                    
                      
  TEST        <- list(method = method, data.name = data.name,

                    		
                  

                  

                    329
                    1x
                    
                      
                      null.value = null.value, alternative = alternative,

                    		
                  

                  

                    330
                    1x
                    
                      
                      estimate = estimate, statistic = statistic, p.value = p.value);

                    		
                  

                  

                    331
                    1x
                    
                      
  class(TEST) <- "htest";

                    		
                  

                  

                    332
                    1x
                    
                      
  TEST;

                    		
                  

                  

                    333
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    334
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    335
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    336
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    337
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    338
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    339
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Generate Oscillating Response Pattern

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This function creates a response pattern that oscillates around the baseline,

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' with some doses showing increases and others showing decreases.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param doses Vector of dose values

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param max_effect Maximum magnitude of effect (both positive and negative)

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param frequency How many complete oscillations across the dose range

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param baseline Baseline response value

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Vector of response values

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords simulation

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
oscillating_response <- function(doses, max_effect = 20, frequency = 1, baseline = 100,dose_range=c(0,20)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
  # Normalize doses to 0-1 range for easier calculation

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
  ## dose_range <- range(doses)  ## note that you cannot put in doses as a single number in this case, I would add to

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    !
                    
                      
  normalized_doses <- (doses - dose_range[1]) / (dose_range[2] - dose_range[1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
  # Calculate oscillating response using sine function

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
  # Multiply by 2π*frequency to get desired number of oscillations

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    !
                    
                      
  response <- baseline + max_effect * sin(2 * pi * frequency * normalized_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    !
                    
                      
  return(response)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' Wrapper around rdrm

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Wrapper around rdrm to generate a data frame or a tibble object instead of a list of two matrices

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nosim numeric. The number of simulated curves to be returned.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @param fct list. Any built-in function in the package drc or a list with similar components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @param mpar numeric. The model parameters to be supplied to fct.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xerror numeric or character. The distribution for the dose values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xpar numeric vector supplying the parameter values defining the distribution for the dose values. If xerror is a distribution then remember that the number of dose values also is part of this argument (the first argument).

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @param yerror numeric or character. The error distribution for the response values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ypar numeric vector supplying the parameter values defining the error distribution for the response values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @param onlyY logical. If TRUE then only the response values are returned (useful in simulations). Otherwise both dose values and response values (and for binomial data also the weights) are returned.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso [drc::rdrm()], [MCPMod::genDFdata()]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords simulation

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' \dontrun{

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' dat <- rdrm(1, LL.3(), c(`b:(Intercept)` = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' `d:(Intercept)` = 8, `e:(Intercept)` = 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' xerror=c(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.94, 0.94, 0.94, 1.88, 1.88, 1.88, 3.75,

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'          3.75, 3.75, 7.5, 7.5, 7.5, 15, 15, 15, 30, 30, 30),

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' yerror = "rnorm", ypar = c(0, 0.6))

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' dat <- data.frame(Dose = dat$x[1,], Response = dat$y[1,])

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' simDRdata(10, LL.3(), c(`b:(Intercept)` = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' `d:(Intercept)` = 8, `e:(Intercept)` = 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' xerror=c(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.94, 0.94, 0.94, 1.88, 1.88, 1.88, 3.75,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'          3.75, 3.75, 7.5, 7.5, 7.5, 15, 15, 15, 30, 30, 30),

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' yerror = "rnorm", ypar = c(0, 0.6))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
simDRdata <- function(nosim, fct, mpar, xerror, xpar = 1, yerror = "rnorm",

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
                      ypar = c(0, 1), onlyY = FALSE){

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    4x
                    
                      
  if(yerror=="rbinom"){

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
    dat <- drc::rdrm(nosim=nosim, fct=fct, mpar=mpar, xerror=xerror, xpar=xpar , yerror="rbinom" , ypar=ypar, onlyY=onlyY)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
    if(onlyY){

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    !
                    
                      
      dat <- plyr::ldply(1:nosim,function(i) data.frame(Dose=xerror,Response=dat$y[i,],Weight=ypar,Sim=paste("Sim",i) ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
    } else

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
      dat <- plyr::ldply(1:nosim,function(i) data.frame(Dose=dat$x[i,],Response=dat$y[i,],Weight=dat$w[i,],Sim=paste("Sim",i) ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  }else{

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    3x
                    
                      
    if(yerror=="rnorm"){

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    3x
                    
                      
      dat <- drc::rdrm(nosim=nosim, fct=fct, mpar=mpar, xerror=xerror, xpar=xpar , yerror="rnorm" , ypar=ypar, onlyY=onlyY)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    3x
                    
                      
      if(onlyY){

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1x
                    
                      
        dat <- plyr::ldply(1:nosim,function(i) data.frame(Dose=xerror,Response=dat$y[i,],Sim=paste("Sim",i) ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
      } else

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    2x
                    
                      
        dat <- plyr::ldply(1:nosim,function(i) data.frame(Dose=dat$x[i,],Response=dat$y[i,],Sim=paste("Sim",i) ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    4x
                    
                      
  return(dat)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
#' Simulate Hierarchical Dose-Response Data with Inhomogeneous Variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#' This function simulates dose-response data with a hierarchical structure:

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' n doses, m tanks per dose, and optionally k individuals per tank, with variance components

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#' that can vary by dose level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n_doses Number of dose levels

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose_range Vector of length 2 specifying the min and max dose values

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#' @param m_tanks Number of tanks per dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' @param k_individuals Number of individuals per tank (only used if include_individuals = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#' @param var_tank Variance at the tank level. Can be a single value or a vector of length n_doses.

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#' @param var_individual Variance at the individual level. Can be a single value or a vector of length n_doses.

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#' @param include_individuals Logical, whether to simulate individual-level data (TRUE) or only tank-level data (FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response_function Function that calculates the response given a dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Additional parameters to pass to the response_function

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A data frame containing the simulated dose-response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords simulation

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
simulate_dose_response <- function(n_doses,

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
                                   dose_range = c(0, 20),

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
                                   m_tanks = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
                                   k_individuals = 10,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
                                   var_tank = 4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
                                   var_individual = 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
                                   include_individuals = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
                                   response_function = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
                                   ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
  # Set default response function if not provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.null(response_function)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    !
                    
                      
    response_function <- function(dose, lower = 0, upper = 100, ED50 = 10, slope = 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    !
                    
                      
      lower + (upper - lower) / (1 + exp(-slope * (dose - ED50)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
  # Define doses

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    !
                    
                      
  doses <- seq(dose_range[1], dose_range[2], length.out = n_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
  # Handle variance parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
  # If var_tank is a single value, replicate it for each dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    !
                    
                      
  if (length(var_tank) == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    !
                    
                      
    var_tank <- rep(var_tank, n_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    !
                    
                      
  } else if (length(var_tank) != n_doses) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
    stop("var_tank must be either a single value or a vector of length n_doses")

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
  # If var_individual is a single value, replicate it for each dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    !
                    
                      
  if (length(var_individual) == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    !
                    
                      
    var_individual <- rep(var_individual, n_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    !
                    
                      
  } else if (length(var_individual) != n_doses) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
    stop("var_individual must be either a single value or a vector of length n_doses")

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
  # Create a lookup table for variances by dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    !
                    
                      
  var_lookup <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    !
                    
                      
    Dose = doses,

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    !
                    
                      
    var_tank = var_tank,

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    !
                    
                      
    var_individual = var_individual

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    !
                    
                      
  if (include_individuals) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
    # Simulate data with individuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
    # Create a data frame with all combinations of dose, tank, and individual

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- expand.grid(

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    !
                    
                      
      Dose = doses,

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    !
                    
                      
      Tank = 1:m_tanks,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    !
                    
                      
      Individual = 1:k_individuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
    # Calculate the base response for each dose (vectorized)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$BaseResponse <- response_function(simulated_data$Dose, ...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
    # Merge with variance lookup table to get the appropriate variances for each dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- merge(simulated_data, var_lookup, by = "Dose")

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
    # Generate tank-level random effects (vectorized)

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
    # Create a unique identifier for each dose-tank combination

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$DoseTank <- paste(simulated_data$Dose, simulated_data$Tank, sep = "_")

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    !
                    
                      
    unique_dose_tanks <- unique(simulated_data[, c("DoseTank", "var_tank")])

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
    # Generate tank effects for each unique dose-tank combination

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    !
                    
                      
    tank_effects <- sapply(1:nrow(unique_dose_tanks), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    !
                    
                      
      stats::rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sqrt(unique_dose_tanks$var_tank[i]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    !
                    
                      
    names(tank_effects) <- unique_dose_tanks$DoseTank

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
    # Add tank effects to the data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$TankEffect <- tank_effects[simulated_data$DoseTank]

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      
    # Generate individual-level random effects (vectorized)

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$IndividualEffect <- sapply(1:nrow(simulated_data), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    !
                    
                      
      stats::rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sqrt(simulated_data$var_individual[i]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      
    # Calculate the final response

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$Response <- simulated_data$BaseResponse + simulated_data$TankEffect + simulated_data$IndividualEffect

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
    # Clean up the data frame by removing intermediate columns

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- simulated_data[, c("Dose", "Tank", "Individual", "Response")]

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
    # Simulate data at tank level only

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
    # Create a data frame with all combinations of dose and tank

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- expand.grid(

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    !
                    
                      
      Dose = doses,

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    !
                    
                      
      Tank = 1:m_tanks

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    
                    
                      
    # Calculate the base response for each dose (vectorized)

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$BaseResponse <- response_function(simulated_data$Dose, ...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
    # Merge with variance lookup table to get the appropriate variances for each dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- merge(simulated_data, var_lookup, by = "Dose")

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      
    # Generate tank-level random effects with dose-specific variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$TankEffect <- sapply(1:nrow(simulated_data), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    !
                    
                      
      stats::rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sqrt(simulated_data$var_tank[i]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      
    # Calculate the final response (no individual effects)

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data$Response <- simulated_data$BaseResponse + simulated_data$TankEffect

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    
                    
                      
    # Clean up the data frame by removing intermediate columns

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    !
                    
                      
    simulated_data <- simulated_data[, c("Dose", "Tank", "Response")]

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    !
                    
                      
  return(simulated_data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      
#' Adding detailed logging

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    
                    
                      
#' @param message message to be written

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    
                    
                      
#' @param log_file file to be appended to

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    
                    
                      
#' @return log_file with series of messages if specified in the simulation

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
log_message <- function(message, log_file = "simulation_log.txt") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    !
                    
                      
  timestamp <- format(Sys.time(), "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    !
                    
                      
  log_entry <- paste0("[", timestamp, "] ", message)

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    !
                    
                      
  cat(log_entry, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    !
                    
                      
  cat(log_entry, "\n", file = log_file, append = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
## Note this script is adapted from the archived version of RSCABS developed by Joe Swintek [aut, cre],

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
## Kevin Flynn[ctb].	RSCABS_0.9.5.tar.gz	2020-05-01 08:50	(https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/RSCABS/)

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
## Original package licence is License: CC0, which means no copyrights reserved. However,

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
## the author and the archive link are kept in this file so the source can be traced back.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' Run RSCABS test

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Runs the Rao-Scott adjusted Cochran-Armitage trend test by slices (RSCABS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' analysis.The function is adapted from the archived version of RSCABS developed by

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Joe Swintek et al with CC0 license. It is not updated anymore and included

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' for validation purpose. It is provided in this package a different function

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' to perform the same task.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data A standard data set in the tall format.  Every row indicates an organism.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' The data set must contain columns for the treatment level and every tested histological endpoint.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment The name of the column that contains the information about the treatment level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' Increasing values indicate higher treatments.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Replicate The name of the column that contains the information about the replicate structure.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' If the  replicate is not specified this will default to running "CA" as the test type.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Effects The endpoint to be tested.  Defaults to all columns that have integers less then 20.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' The analysis assumes that higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test.type Indicate the type of analysis to be performed.  Use "RS" to select the Rao-Scott

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' adjustment to the Cochran-Armitage test and "CA" to ignore the adjustment.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a table of the test results for each treatment and injury score.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @references Green, John W. and Springer, Timothy A. and Saulnier, Amy N. and Swintek, Joe,

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' (2014) Statistical analysis of histopathological endpoints. Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry, 33(5), 1108-1116

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Joe Swintek

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples \dontrun{

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'## Not run:

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'#Take the subset corresponding to F0-females of 16 weeks of age

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'data(exampleHistData)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'exampleHistData.sub<-exampleHistData[which(exampleHistData$Generation=='F2' &

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'              exampleHistData$Genotypic_Sex=='Female' & exampleHistData$Age=='16_wk' ),  ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'  #Run RSCABS

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'  eampleResults<-runRSCABS(exampleHistData.sub,'Treatment',

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'                           'Replicate',test.type='RS')

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
runRSCABS <- function(Data,Treatment,Replicate='',Effects='',test.type='RS'){

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
  #This function will produce a table of step-down Cochran-Armitage trend tests with possible Rao-Scott adjustment by slices

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
  #It will Run the test on every effect in the Effect list

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
  #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
  #Turn Replicate and Treatment into factors

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1x
                    
                      
  Data[ ,Treatment]<-as.factor(Data[ ,Treatment])

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    1x
                    
                      
  if ( identical(Replicate,'') == FALSE && identical(test.type,'CA')==FALSE){

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    1x
                    
                      
    Data[ ,Replicate]<-as.factor(Data[ ,Replicate])

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
  }else{

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    !
                    
                      
    test.type='CA'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    !
                    
                      
    Replicate<-'FalseReplicateFill'

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    !
                    
                      
    Data$FalseReplicateFill<-as.factor(1:length(Data[ ,Treatment])) #Needed so R data structure do not change type.

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (test.type != 'RS' & test.type != 'CA'){

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    !
                    
                      
    message('Error: Invalid test type')

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
    return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  #Remove all non-whole numbers

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  #Default for effect every column name that is not a Treatment, Replicate, and has a 0 < K.max < 20

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  #turn off warnings

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    1x
                    
                      
  options(warn = -1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (Effects ==''){

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
    Effects<-colnames(Data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    !
                    
                      
    cind <- unlist(lapply(Data, is.numeric))

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    !
                    
                      
    Effects<-colnames(Data)[cind]

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    !
                    
                      
    Maxes<-apply(Data[,cind],2,max,na.rm=TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
    keepInd <- which(Maxes>0 & Maxes < 20)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    !
                    
                      
    Effects<- Effects[keepInd]

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  #Changed to account for just 1 effect

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (length(Effects)>1){

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
    Data[ ,Effects]<-apply(Data[ ,Effects],2,convert2Score)

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
  }else{

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    1x
                    
                      
    Data[ ,Effects]<-convert2Score(Data[ ,Effects])

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
  options(warn=0) #turn on warnings

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
  #Need to remove factors,done 01.2025,ZG

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
  #Prep Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
  Data.Prep<-sapply(c('&Fill#',Effects),prepDataRSCABS,Data=Data,Treatment=Treatment,Replicate=Replicate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    1x
                    
                      
  Results.Raw<-sapply(c('&Fill#',Effects),stepKRSCABS,Data=Data.Prep,Treatment=Treatment,Replicate=Replicate,test.type=test.type)

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
  Results<-do.call("rbind", lapply(Results.Raw, data.frame, stringsAsFactors = FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (length(which(is.finite(Results[  ,'Statistic'])==FALSE))>0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1x
                    
                      
    Results<-Results[-which(is.finite(Results[  ,'Statistic'])==FALSE), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    1x
                    
                      
  rownames(Results)<-{}

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    1x
                    
                      
  return(Results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
#' Runs the kth slice of RSCABS

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x.i.j matrix containing the number of observed "successes" for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n.i.j matrix containing the number of observations for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
#' @param m.i matrix of number units in each treatment/replicate combination.

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
#' @param TestK The kth severity score being tested.

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test.type Indicate the type  of analysis to be performed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
#' Use "RS" to select the Rao-Scott adjustment to the Cochran-Armitage test

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
#' and "CA" to ignore the adjustment.

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Returns a list with the following values:

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{Response}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
#'   The endpoint that is being tested.

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{Treatment}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
#'   The treatment level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{R-Score}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
#'   The severity score from the histology.

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{Statistic}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
#'   The test statistic corresponding to that row's endpoint treatment level and R-Score.

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
#' 	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
#' 	\item{P-Value}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
#' 		The corresponding p-value

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
#' 	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
#' 	\item{Signif}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      
#' 		The significance flag where the cutoffs for stars and dot are 0, 1e-04, 0.001, 0.01,0.05,1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
#' 	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Joe Swintek

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
RSCABK <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
  function(x.i.j,n.i.j,m.i,TestK,test.type){

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
    #This function is called for the detailed results functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
    #This is just for 1 slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    18x
                    
                      
    K=1

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
    #Variable names are the same as in Rao and Scott 1992

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    18x
                    
                      
    x.i<-colSums(x.i.j)  #Number of successful observations

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    18x
                    
                      
    n.i<-colSums(n.i.j)  #Total Number in a treatment

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    18x
                    
                      
    p.i.hat=x.i/n.i

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
    #Calculate r.ij.sum.sq

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
    #this uses the expanded form of sigma(r.ij) squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    18x
                    
                      
    r.ij.sum.sq<-mat.or.vec(length(m.i)[1],K)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    18x
                    
                      
    p.i.hat.k<-apply(t(p.i.hat),2,rep,dim(n.i.j)[1])  #p.hat

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    18x
                    
                      
    if(test.type =='CA'){

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    !
                    
                      
      d.i<-1  #No adjustment

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    18x
                    
                      
    if(test.type =='RS'){

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
      #Calculate the Rao-Scott adjustment

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    18x
                    
                      
      x.ij.sum.sq<-colSums(x.i.j^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    18x
                    
                      
      cross<- -2*colSums(x.i.j*n.i.j*p.i.hat.k)
