                    167
                    18x
                    
                      
      last.sum.sq<-colSums((n.i.j*p.i.hat.k)^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    18x
                    
                      
      r.ij.sum.sq<-x.ij.sum.sq+cross+last.sum.sq;

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    18x
                    
                      
      v.i <- m.i/(m.i - 1)/n.i^2 *r.ij.sum.sq

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    18x
                    
                      
      d.i <- n.i * v.i/(p.i.hat * (1 - p.i.hat))

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    18x
                    
                      
      d.i[which(is.na(d.i))]<-1    #Ignores the correction when incidence is 0% or 100%

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    18x
                    
                      
      d.i[which(is.nan(d.i))]<-1   #Ignores the correction when incidence is 0% or 100%

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    18x
                    
                      
      d.i[which(d.i<1)]<-1         #Cf Rao and Scott Clustered Poisson paper;

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      
    #apply adjustment

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    18x
                    
                      
    x.i.new <- x.i/d.i

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    18x
                    
                      
    n.i.new <- n.i/d.i

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    18x
                    
                      
    scores<-matrix(1:length(x.i.new)-1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    18x
                    
                      
    p.hat <- sum(x.i.new)/sum(n.i.new)

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    18x
                    
                      
    mean.score <- sum(scores * n.i.new)/sum(n.i.new)

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    18x
                    
                      
    var.scores <- sum(n.i.new * (scores - mean.score)^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    18x
                    
                      
    RS <- (sum(x.i.new * scores) - p.hat * sum(n.i.new * scores))/sqrt(p.hat * (1 - p.hat) * var.scores) #the statistic value

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
    #P-Value

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    18x
                    
                      
    p.val <- pnorm(abs(RS), lower.tail = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    18x
                    
                      
    p.val<-1-p.val

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    18x
                    
                      
    if (is.finite(p.val)==FALSE){

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    2x
                    
                      
      p.val<-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
    #Adds marks for significance

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    18x
                    
                      
    Sig<-rep('.',length(p.val))

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    18x
                    
                      
    Sig[which(p.val<=.05)]<-'*'

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    18x
                    
                      
    Sig[which(p.val<=.01)]<-'**'

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    18x
                    
                      
    Sig[which(p.val<=.001)]<-'***'

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    18x
                    
                      
    return (list('Treatment'=max(scores)+1,'R-Score'=TestK,'Statistic' = RS, 'P-Value' = p.val,'Signif'=Sig))

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
#' Convert Values to Scores

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    
                    
                      
#' Converts any non-positive numbers to NA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Dvec A numeric vector to be converted.

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector with non-positive values set to NA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
convert2Score <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      
  function(Dvec){

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      
    #This Function will convert any object that is not zero or a positive number to NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    2x
                    
                      
    oldw <- getOption("warn")

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    2x
                    
                      
    options(warn=-1)  #Turn off warnings

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    2x
                    
                      
    Dvec<-as.numeric(as.character(Dvec))  #Will induce a a warning

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    2x
                    
                      
    Dvec[which(Dvec<0)]<-NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    2x
                    
                      
    options(warn=oldw) #Turn on warnings

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    2x
                    
                      
    return(Dvec)

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    
                    
                      
#' Prepares data for an RSCABS analysis

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Effect The endpoint being converted.

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data The tall formatted data set.

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment The name of the treatment variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Replicate The name of the replicate variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Returns a list containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{x.i.j}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    
                    
                      
#'   matrix containing the number of observed "successes" for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{n.i.j}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    
                    
                      
#'   matrix containing the number of observations for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{m.i}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    242
                    
                    
                      
#'   matrix of number replicates in each treatment-replicate combination.

                    		
                  

                  

                    243
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    244
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{K.max}{

                    		
                  

                  

                    245
                    
                    
                      
#'   The maximum severity score for the endpoint.

                    		
                  

                  

                    246
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    247
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    248
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    249
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Joe Swintek

                    		
                  

                  

                    250
                    
                    
                      
prepDataRSCABS <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    251
                    
                    
                      
  function(Effect='',Data={},Treatment='',Replicate=''){

                    		
                  

                  

                    252
                    
                    
                      
    #Data Transform from a list of individuals to matrix format

                    		
                  

                  

                    253
                    
                    
                      
    #This will take Clustered Data and convert it to by

                    		
                  

                  

                    254
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    255
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    256
                    3x
                    
                      
    if(Effect=='&Fill#'){ #ensures the correct data structure output

                    		
                  

                  

                    257
                    1x
                    
                      
      return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    258
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    259
                    2x
                    
                      
    if(length(which(colnames(Data)==Effect))==0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    260
                    !
                    
                      
      print(paste(Effect,' is not in data set. Ending function.',sep=''))

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    !
                    
                      
      return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    2x
                    
                      
    K.max<-max(Data[ ,Effect],na.rm=TRUE) #max K score

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    
                    
                      
    #Remove NA and negative numbers

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (length(which(is.na(Data[ ,Effect])))>0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    !
                    
                      
      Data<-Data[-which(is.na(Data[ ,Effect])), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (length(which(Data[ ,Effect]<0))>0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    !
                    
                      
      Data<-Data[-which(Data[ ,Effect]<0), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    
                    
                      
    #Convert Factors to Numerics

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    2x
                    
                      
    Data[ ,Effect]<-as.numeric(Data[ ,Effect])

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (K.max==0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    !
                    
                      
      print(paste('There is no variation in ',Effect,'. Ending function.',sep=''))

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    !
                    
                      
      return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    
                    
                      
    #Replicates are rows, Treatment are columns  [Replicate,Treatment]

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    !
                    
                      
    if(!is.factor(Data[,Replicate])) Data[,Replicate] <- factor(Data[,Replicate])

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    2x
                    
                      
    n.i.j<-xtabs( ~Data[[Replicate]]+Data[[Treatment]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    2x
                    
                      
    m.i<-apply(n.i.j,2,function(Vec){

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    6x
                    
                      
      if (length(which(Vec==0))>0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    !
                    
                      
        Vec<-Vec[-which(Vec==0)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    286
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    287
                    6x
                    
                      
      return(length(Vec))

                    		
                  

                  

                    288
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    289
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    2x
                    
                      
    x.i.j<-array(dim=c(dim(n.i.j)[1],dim(n.i.j)[2],K.max)) #Declare x.i.j , frequency array of scores k or larger

                    		
                  

                  

                    294
                    
                    
                      
    #Each k level is on the 3rd dimension

                    		
                  

                  

                    295
                    
                    
                      
    ## browser()

                    		
                  

                  

                    296
                    2x
                    
                      
    for (K in 1:K.max){

                    		
                  

                  

                    297
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    298
                    22x
                    
                      
      x.i.j[ , ,K]<-xtabs( ~Data[[Replicate]]+Data[[Treatment]],subset=Data[ ,Effect]>=K)

                    		
                  

                  

                    299
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    300
                    2x
                    
                      
    RSCABS.Prep.Data<-list(x.i.j=x.i.j,n.i.j=n.i.j,m.i=m.i,K.max=K.max)

                    		
                  

                  

                    301
                    2x
                    
                      
    return(RSCABS.Prep.Data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    302
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    303
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    304
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    305
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the step down aspect of RSCABS

                    		
                  

                  

                    306
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    307
                    
                    
                      
#' @param TestK The severity score being tested

                    		
                  

                  

                    308
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x.i.j Matrix containing the number of observed "successes" for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    309
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n.i.j Matrix containing the number of observations for replicate i on treatment j.

                    		
                  

                  

                    310
                    
                    
                      
#' @param m.i Matrix of number units in each treatment/replicate combination.

                    		
                  

                  

                    311
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Effect The the end point to be tested.

                    		
                  

                  

                    312
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test.type Indicate the type  of analysis to be performed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    313
                    
                    
                      
#' Use "RS" to select the Rao-Scott adjustment to the Cochran-Armitage test

                    		
                  

                  

                    314
                    
                    
                      
#' and "CA" to ignore the adjustment

                    		
                  

                  

                    315
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    316
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \item{Result.K}{An intermediary result.}

                    		
                  

                  

                    317
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    318
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    319
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Joe Swintek

                    		
                  

                  

                    320
                    
                    
                      
stepDownRSCABS <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    321
                    
                    
                      
  function(TestK,x.i.j,n.i.j,m.i,Effect,test.type){

                    		
                  

                  

                    322
                    11x
                    
                      
    Next<-0; #Step Down test

                    		
                  

                  

                    323
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    324
                    
                    
                      
    #Replicates are rows, Treatment are columns  [Replicate,Treatment]

                    		
                  

                  

                    325
                    11x
                    
                      
    Result.K<-as.data.frame({})

                    		
                  

                  

                    326
                    11x
                    
                      
    x.i.j.K<-x.i.j[ , ,TestK]

                    		
                  

                  

                    327
                    11x
                    
                      
    while (Next==0){

                    		
                  

                  

                    328
                    17x
                    
                      
      Result<-RSCABK(x.i.j.K,n.i.j,m.i,TestK,test.type=test.type)

                    		
                  

                  

                    329
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    330
                    
                    
                      
      #The step down

                    		
                  

                  

                    331
                    17x
                    
                      
      Next<- Result['P-Value']>0.05 | dim(x.i.j.K)[2]<=2 #Stop conditions of

                    		
                  

                  

                    332
                    
                    
                      
      ## too high of p.val or 2 treatments

                    		
                  

                  

                    333
                    17x
                    
                      
      x.i.j.K<-x.i.j.K[ ,-dim(x.i.j.K)[2]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    334
                    17x
                    
                      
      n.i.j<-n.i.j[ ,-dim(n.i.j)[2]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    335
                    17x
                    
                      
      m.i<-m.i[-length(m.i)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    336
                    17x
                    
                      
      Result.K<-rbind(Result.K, as.data.frame(Result))

                    		
                  

                  

                    337
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    338
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    339
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    340
                    
                    
                      
    ## Result.K<-rbind(Result.K, as.data.frame(Result))

                    		
                  

                  

                    341
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    342
                    11x
                    
                      
    Effect<-paste(Effect,TestK,sep='')

                    		
                  

                  

                    343
                    11x
                    
                      
    Result.K<-cbind(Effect,Result.K)

                    		
                  

                  

                    344
                    11x
                    
                      
    return (Result.K)

                    		
                  

                  

                    345
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    346
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    347
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    348
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    349
                    
                    
                      
#' plotRSCABS

                    		
                  

                  

                    350
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    351
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    352
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    353
                    
                    
                      
#' Steps through the severity score for a given effect

                    		
                  

                  

                    354
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    355
                    
                    
                      
#' An internal function for stepping through each severity score of an endpoint.

                    		
                  

                  

                    356
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    357
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Effect Endpoint being tested.

                    		
                  

                  

                    358
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Data.Prep Data prepared by prepDataRSCABS.

                    		
                  

                  

                    359
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Treatment Name of the treatment variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    360
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Replicate Name of the replicate variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    361
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test.type Indicate the type of analysis to be performed.  Use "RS" to select

                    		
                  

                  

                    362
                    
                    
                      
#' the Rao-Scott adjustment to the Cochran-Armitage test and "CA" to ignore the adjustment.

                    		
                  

                  

                    363
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    364
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Results.Effect

                    		
                  

                  

                    365
                    
                    
                      
#' \itemize{

                    		
                  

                  

                    366
                    
                    
                      
#' \item{Results.Effect}{ An intermediary step for results. }

                    		
                  

                  

                    367
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    368
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    369
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    370
                    
                    
                      
#' @author Joe Swintek

                    		
                  

                  

                    371
                    
                    
                      
stepKRSCABS <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    372
                    
                    
                      
  function(Effect,Data.Prep,Treatment,Replicate,test.type){

                    		
                  

                  

                    373
                    
                    
                      
    #This iterates though each k-level

                    		
                  

                  

                    374
                    
                    
                      
    #' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    375
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (is.null(Data.Prep[[Effect]])==TRUE){ #Skip effects not needed

                    		
                  

                  

                    376
                    1x
                    
                      
      return()

                    		
                  

                  

                    377
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    378
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    379
                    1x
                    
                      
    x.i.j<-Data.Prep[[Effect]]$x.i.j

                    		
                  

                  

                    380
                    1x
                    
                      
    n.i.j<-Data.Prep[[Effect]]$n.i.j

                    		
                  

                  

                    381
                    1x
                    
                      
    m.i<-Data.Prep[[Effect]]$m.i

                    		
                  

                  

                    382
                    1x
                    
                      
    K.max<-Data.Prep[[Effect]]$K.max

                    		
                  

                  

                    383
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    384
                    1x
                    
                      
    Results.Effect<-lapply(1:K.max,stepDownRSCABS,x.i.j=x.i.j,n.i.j=n.i.j,m.i=m.i,Effect=Effect,test.type=test.type) #each k-level

                    		
                  

                  

                    385
                    1x
                    
                      
    Results.Effect<-do.call("rbind", lapply(Results.Effect, data.frame, stringsAsFactors = FALSE))  #'fix' output table

                    		
                  

                  

                    386
                    1x
                    
                      
    return(Results.Effect)

                    		
                  

                  

                    387
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    388
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
## Function to calculate NOECs using multiple methods and broomed together

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
## Unit Testing in # FILE: tests/testthat/test_quantal_categorical.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate NOEC Using Many-to-one Pairwise Tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' This function calculates the No Observed Effect Concentration (NOEC) from dose response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' using pairwise comparison tests from the rstatix package.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data A data frame containing the dose response data

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param response The name of the response variable (unquoted)

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param dose The name of the dose variable (unquoted)

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param control The level of the dose variable to be used as control

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test The statistical test to use: "t.test" or "wilcox.test"

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p_adjust_method Method for p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alternative Direction of the alternative hypothesis: "two.sided", "greater", or "less"

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Significance level (default: 0.05)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the NOEC value and the full test results

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom dplyr mutate filter arrange %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom rlang enquo quo_name .data

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom rstatix t_test wilcox_test

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats as.formula setNames

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
calculate_noec_rstatix <- function(data, response, dose, control = "0",

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
                                   test = c("t.test", "wilcox.test"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
                                   p_adjust_method = "holm",

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
                                   alternative = "two.sided",

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
                                   alpha = 0.05) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
  # Match test argument

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    10x
                    
                      
  test <- match.arg(test)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
  # Capture variable names using rlang

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    10x
                    
                      
  response_var <- rlang::enquo(response)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    10x
                    
                      
  dose_var <- rlang::enquo(dose)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    10x
                    
                      
  response_name <- rlang::quo_name(response_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    10x
                    
                      
  dose_name <- rlang::quo_name(dose_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
  # Ensure dose is a factor

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (!is.factor(data[[dose_name]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    9x
                    
                      
    data[[dose_name]] <- as.factor(data[[dose_name]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
  # Create formula

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    10x
                    
                      
  formula_obj <- stats::as.formula(paste(response_name, "~", dose_name))

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
  # Run the appropriate test

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (test == "t.test") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    9x
                    
                      
    test_results <- rstatix::t_test(

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    9x
                    
                      
      data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    9x
                    
                      
      formula = formula_obj,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    9x
                    
                      
      ref.group = control,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    9x
                    
                      
      p.adjust.method = p_adjust_method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    9x
                    
                      
      alternative = alternative

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    1x
                    
                      
  } else if (test == "wilcox.test") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1x
                    
                      
    test_results <- rstatix::wilcox_test(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1x
                    
                      
      data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
      formula = formula_obj,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
      ref.group = control,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    1x
                    
                      
      p.adjust.method = p_adjust_method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
      alternative = alternative

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
  # Extract dose levels and convert to numeric for sorting

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    10x
                    
                      
  dose_levels <- levels(data[[dose_name]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    10x
                    
                      
  numeric_doses <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(dose_levels))

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
  # If conversion to numeric was successful, reorder the test results

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (!any(is.na(numeric_doses))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
    # Create a mapping from dose level to numeric value

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    10x
                    
                      
    dose_mapping <- stats::setNames(numeric_doses, dose_levels)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
    # Add numeric dose values to test results

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    10x
                    
                      
    test_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    10x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    10x
                    
                      
        group1_numeric = dose_mapping[.data$group1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    10x
                    
                      
        group2_numeric = dose_mapping[.data$group2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
    # Determine which column contains the non-control doses

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    10x
                    
                      
    if (all(test_results$group1 == control)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    10x
                    
                      
      test_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    10x
                    
                      
        dplyr::mutate(dose_numeric = .data$group2_numeric)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
    } else if (all(test_results$group2 == control)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    !
                    
                      
      test_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
        dplyr::mutate(dose_numeric = .data$group1_numeric)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
      # Mixed case - need to handle both possibilities

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
      test_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    !
                    
                      
        dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    !
                    
                      
          dose_numeric = ifelse(.data$group1 == control,

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    !
                    
                      
                                .data$group2_numeric,

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    !
                    
                      
                                .data$group1_numeric)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
    # Sort by numeric dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    10x
                    
                      
    test_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    10x
                    
                      
      dplyr::arrange(.data$dose_numeric)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
  # Find the NOEC (highest dose with p > alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    10x
                    
                      
  significant_results <- test_results %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    10x
                    
                      
    dplyr::filter(.data$p.adj <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    10x
                    
                      
  if (nrow(significant_results) == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
    # If no significant differences, NOEC is the highest tested dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    1x
                    
                      
    all_doses <- as.numeric(as.character(unique(data[[dose_name]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    1x
                    
                      
    all_doses <- all_doses[!is.na(all_doses) & all_doses != as.numeric(control)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (length(all_doses) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    1x
                    
                      
      noec_value <- max(all_doses, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    1x
                    
                      
      noec_message <- "No significant effects detected at any dose level"

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    !
                    
                      
      noec_value <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    !
                    
                      
      noec_message <- "No valid dose levels found"

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
    # Get all doses with significant effects

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    9x
                    
                      
    significant_doses <- c()

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    9x
                    
                      
    for (i in 1:nrow(significant_results)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    23x
                    
                      
      row <- significant_results[i, ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    23x
                    
                      
      if (row$group1 == control) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    23x
                    
                      
        significant_doses <- c(significant_doses, as.character(row$group2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    !
                    
                      
        significant_doses <- c(significant_doses, as.character(row$group1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
    # Convert to numeric for comparison

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    9x
                    
                      
    significant_doses <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(significant_doses))

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
    # Get all tested doses

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    9x
                    
                      
    all_doses <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(as.character(unique(data[[dose_name]]))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    9x
                    
                      
    all_doses <- all_doses[!is.na(all_doses) & all_doses != as.numeric(control)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    9x
                    
                      
    all_doses <- sort(all_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
    # Find the highest non-significant dose

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    9x
                    
                      
    non_significant_doses <- all_doses[!all_doses %in% significant_doses]

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    9x
                    
                      
    if (length(non_significant_doses) == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
      # If all doses show significant effects

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    1x
                    
                      
      noec_value <- as.numeric(control)

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    1x
                    
                      
      noec_message <- "All tested doses showed significant effects"

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    8x
                    
                      
      noec_value <- max(non_significant_doses)

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    8x
                    
                      
      noec_message <- paste("NOEC determined as", noec_value)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
  # Return both the NOEC value and the full test results

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    10x
                    
                      
  return(list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    10x
                    
                      
    noec = noec_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    10x
                    
                      
    noec_message = noec_message,

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    10x
                    
                      
    test_results = test_results

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
  ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Cochran-Armitage Trend Test for Binomial Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs a Cochran-Armitage test for trend in binomial proportions across

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' ordered groups, with an optional Rao-Scott correction for overdispersion.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param successes Numeric vector of successes (e.g., number of survivors).

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param totals Numeric vector of total observations (e.g., total organisms).

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param doses Numeric vector of dose levels or scores corresponding to each observation.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alternative Character string specifying the alternative hypothesis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'        Must be one of "two.sided" (default), "greater", or "less".

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param rao_scott Logical indicating whether to apply Rao-Scott correction for

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'        overdispersion (default: FALSE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phi Overdispersion parameter for Rao-Scott correction. If NULL (default),

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'        it will be estimated from the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{statistic}{Test statistic (Z score)}

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{p.value}{P-value for the test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{method}{Description of the test performed}

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{alternative}{The alternative hypothesis}

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{data.name}{Description of the data}

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   \item{phi}{Overdispersion parameter (only if rao_scott = TRUE)}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' The Cochran-Armitage test is used to detect trends in binomial proportions

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' across ordered groups. The test statistic follows a standard normal distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' under the null hypothesis of no trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
